result.execSummary:
The defendant Brett J. Keever was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess/Illegally Obtained Prescription [Modifiers: Repeater], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 450.11(7)(h).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

--serve 30 days in Jefferson County Jail, with Huber privileges

--24 days credit for time already served given

 Defendant is required to report for commencement and service of jail sentence with absolute sobriety and without non-prescribed controlled substances in his/her system.  Non-compliance will result in loss of Huber/work-release privileges without further process.

--DNA Sample and Surcharge not ordered due to date of violation

TIME SERVED SENTENCE

records.addlTxt: Duplicate Original Warrant received from JCSD - Bond posted at Fond du Lac County Jail
JFFO & NOC mailed to Defendant - Unable to Fwd.
RN mailed to defendant - Unable to Fwd.
with Elements and Criminal Case Settlement Attached

Cases 15CM26 & 15CM272 called together at 11:36 am [Clerk SH]
[Reserve Judge Neal Nettesheim presiding for BrIV]
Defendant Brett J. Keever in court, in-custody, with Attorney Elizabeth F Svehlek. ADA Brookellen Teuber appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Svehlek submits custody credit worksheet along with plea paperwork

Constitutional rights given; plea of "Guilty" entered on Count #1-15CM26 & 15CM272; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; Court finds the plea has been entered freely, voluntarily, intelligently and accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, orders JOC entered.

On Count #1-15CM26, the Court sentences Defendant to:
--serve 30 days in Jefferson County Jail, with Huber privileges
--24 days credit for time already served given
--pay costs of $243; due in $35 increments per month beginning 3/1/16 and on the 1st day of the month thereafter until paid in full; non-payment results in a 5 day jail term with Huber privileges, consecutive to be in payment plan with case 15CM272.
--DNA Sample and Surcharge not ordered due to date of violation
TIME SERVED SENTENCE

On Count #1-15CM272, the Court sentences Defendant to:
--serve 10 days in Jefferson County Jail, with Huber privileges; to commence concurrent to Count #1-15CM26  
--22 days credit for time already served given
--pay costs of $443 (includes DNA); due in $35 increments per month beginning 3/1/16 and on the 1st day of the month thereafter until paid in full; non-payment results in a 5 day jail term with Huber privileges, consecutive to be on payment plan with 15CM26.
--DNA sample not ordered due to date of violation
TIME SERVED SENTENCE
Recess: 12:03 pm
Defendant appeared in custody // Duplicate Original Warrant document returned from JCSD

Cases 15CM26 called at 1:36 pm [sf]
Defendant Brett J. Keever in custody, via video from the Jefferson County Jail with Attorney De La Rosa from the Jefferson County Public Defenders Office. Public Service Special Prosecutor Melanie Flint appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Upon stipulation, the Court finds the video connection to be sight and sound sufficient. 
Court reviews warrant was issued by Judge Netteshiem.
Attorney De La Rosa advises that the defendant remains a Jefferson County residence and that he turned himself in on this warrant.

Court requires $500.00 CASH  bond, with conditions: 
--no possession or ingestion of controlled substances without a valid prescription
--no possession of drug paraphernalia
--attend a status review on 

Atty De La Rosa advises the defendant remains eligible for SPD representation.


15CM272 called at 1:39 pm

Address and DOB information verified by the Court or DOB verified. New Address information provided.
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, maximum penalties recited
Plea of "not guilty" entered; speedy trial waived by the Defendant.
Bail/Bond recommendations presented by counsel.

Court requires $150.00 CASH bond, with conditions: 
-No possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid   
  prescription
-No possession of drug paraphernalia without a valid prescription 
-No contact with Rylee O'Donnell


Recess: 1:42 pm
NEXT: (Notices to be mailed)

Status: 1/28/16 at 9:00 am (15CM26 & 15CM272)

Case called at 218pm [mo]
[Reserve Judge Neal Nettesheim presiding for Branch IV]
[Scheduled for Plea and Sentencing]
Attorney Elizabeth F. Svehlek in court.   ADA Brookellen Teuber appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant, Brett Keever does not appear

Atty. Svehlek indicates that she does not have any information regarding Mr. Keever's non appearance
On Motion of the State, the Court issues bench warrant and forfeiture of any bail
recess: 2:19pm
Notice of Hearing for 6/26 Plea/Sent. Hearing sent to LKA
Defendant in custody// Duplicate Original Warrant returned from JCSD

[MK] case called at 1:15pm. 
Defendant Brett J. Keever appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, with Attorney Elizabeth Svehlek.  Public Service Prosecutor Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
On agreement of counsel, the Court finds that the videoconferencing system is sight and sound sufficient. 

Mr. Keever indicates that the 907 Clyman Street, Watertown address is where he receives his mail-- it is his father's residence. 
The Court reserves Mr. Keever's right to speedy trial. 

After hearing arguments of counsel on bond, the Court requires a $350 Cash Bond with the same conditions as previously ordered:  
--no possession or ingestion of controlled substances without a valid prescription
--no possession of drug paraphernalia
recess 1:25pm. 


NEXT: schedule Plea/Sentencing on 6/26/15 at 11:00am

No record made: Case was scheduled for STC. Atty Yelena Zarwell appeared on behalf of the Defendant and ADA Monica Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court notes that there is already pending warrant on file and due to Mr. Keever's non-appearance, warrant is to remain in effect.
NOH for the surety for hearing held yesterday

[Reserve Judge Donald Hassin presiding for BrIV]

Court reviews letter submitted by Ms. Cervantes re: return of bond
ADA Shock: No position
Court presents basis and grants motion to return bond to surety
Court excuses Ms. Cervantes, she exits: 2:28 pm
Court orders issuance of bench warrant - Defendant may post $500 cash in lieu of arrest
Recess: 2:29 pm

case called at 1:19pm [Clerk MO]
Defendant Brett Keever appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, with Attorney Yelena Zarwell (PD will appoint counsel).  Public Service Special Prosecutor, Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin.  

On agreement of counsel, the Court finds that the videoconferencing system is sight and sound sufficient. 

Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited. 
The Defense requests the subsitution of Judge.
The Defense stands 'mute' and the Court enters a 'not guilty' plea on behalf of defense


The Court requires a $150 cash bond, with conditions:
--no possession or ingestion of controlled substances or drugs without a valid prescription
--no possession of drug paraphernalia
recess 1:25pm. 


NEXT: (1) Pretrial Conference: 3/18/15 at 9:20am  (2) Appoint New Judge  (3) Status Conference: To Be Scheduled Once New Assignment of Judge is Concluded
Duplicate original warrant returned//def in custody

case called at 3:16pm. [MK]
Defendant Brett J. Keever not in court.  ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.
The Court finds probable cause to support Count #1 within the Criminal Complaint. 
ADA Shock reports that the mailing to the last known address was returned by the US Postal Service undelivered. 
On request of ADA Shock, the Court issues a Probable Cause Warrant--body only.
recess 3:20pm.
